translated: For mutual action, the forms of sarvanāmas are dual.

original: las phan tshun byed pa rtogs par byed pa la sarba n'a ma rnams kyi gzugs gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: las phan tshun byed pa rtogs par byed pa la sarba n'a ma rnams kyi gzugs gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: For the understanding of mutual action, the forms of sarvanāmas become dual.

original: sa m'a (gcod par byed gcod par byed/) sa batstsa ba hu lam /
analyzed: sa m'a (gcod par byed gcod par byed/) sa batstsa ba hu lam /
translated: SAMA SAMA VAHULA

original: tshig sdud ltar mang po la'o //
analyzed: tshig sdud ltar mang po la'o //
translated: Like a compound word, it is for many.

original: gzugs gnyis su brjod pa can mang po tshig sdud ltar snga ma'i rnam dbye dbyi ba dang mi dbyi ba dang mo rkyen rnams thung ngur 'gyur ba sogs kyang bya'o /🔽(/ su)...aa n+yo& n+yam bi b'a na manti /
analyzed: gzugs gnyis su brjod pa can mang po tshig sdud ltar snga ma'i rnam dbye dbyi ba dang mi dbyi ba dang mo rkyen rnams thung ngur 'gyur ba sogs kyang bya'o / (/ su)...aa n+yo& n+yam bi b'a na manti /
translated: The forms with dual expression are like a compound word, with the case endings of the first being elided or not elided, and the feminine affixes becoming short, and so on.🔽[For example,] ANYO ANYAM VIVANAMANTI.

original: (su)...aa n+yo& n+ye bha dza yanti /
analyzed: (su)...aa n+yo& n+ye bha dza yanti /
translated: ANYO ANYAM BHAJANTĪ.

original: 'grel par lung drangs pa /
analyzed: 'grel par lung drangs pa /
translated: The commentary cites a scripture:

original: ai ta ra shabda sya ni tyam sa m'a sa ba ta /
analyzed: ai ta ra shabda sya ni tyam sa m'a sa ba ta /
translated: ITARASYA NITYAM SAMĀSĀBAVAT.

original: ai ta ra'i sgra ni rtag tu tshig sdud bzhin no //
analyzed: ai ta ra'i sgra ni rtag tu tshig sdud bzhin no //
translated: The word ITARA is always like a compound word.

original: ai ta ra'i sgra ni gzugs gnyis su byas pa na rtag tu tshig sdud bzhin bya ste /
analyzed: ai ta ra'i sgra ni gzugs gnyis su byas pa na rtag tu tshig sdud bzhin bya ste /
translated: The word ITARA, when made into dual form, is always like a compound word.

original: ai ta re ta ram /
analyzed: ai ta re ta ram /
translated: ITARE TARAM.

original: yang 'grel par lung drangs pa /
analyzed: yang 'grel par lung drangs pa /
translated: The Subcommentary cites a passage from scripture:

original: (bram ze phan tshun phyag byed /
analyzed: (bram ze phan tshun phyag byed /
translated: “Brahmins bow to each other

original: phan tshun za bar byed/) str'i na pum sa ka yo rutta ra pa da sya b'a a'a ma bh'a bo b'a tsya:/
analyzed: phan tshun za bar byed/) str'i na pum sa ka yo rutta ra pa da sya b'a a'a ma bh'a bo b'a tsya:/
translated: and eat each other.”

original: bud med dang ma ning dag las tshig phyi ma yang na a'am gyi dngos por brjod do //
analyzed: bud med dang ma ning dag las tshig phyi ma yang na a'am gyi dngos por brjod do //
translated: The last word of the feminine and neuter declensions is expressed as the thing ending in am.🔽The last word of the masculine declension is expressed as the thing ending in am.🔽The last word of the feminine declension is expressed as the thing ending in am.

original: skyes pa'i rtags ma yin pa'i bud med dang ma ning gi rtags (gzhan dang gzhan/) pha rol la tshig snga ma gzugs gnyis su gyur pa de'i phyi ma'i mtha' a'am du yang na 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rtags ma yin pa'i bud med dang ma ning gi rtags (gzhan dang gzhan/) pha rol la tshig snga ma gzugs gnyis su gyur pa de'i phyi ma'i mtha' a'am du yang na 'gyur te /
translated: The last word of the neuter declension is expressed as the thing ending in am.🔽The last word of the masculine declension is expressed as the thing ending in am.🔽The last word of the feminine declension is expressed as the thing ending in am.

original: aa n+yo& n+y'am str'i/...(bud med phan tshun/) pa raspa r'i na pum sa kam/...(pha rol pha rol na ma ning/) aa n+yo& n+y'a mi me br'a hma noo bho dza ya ta:/... ..(bram ze mo 'di dag phan tshun za bar byed/) yang na /🔽(phan tshun nam gzhan dang gzhan/)...aa n+yo& n+yam /
analyzed: aa n+yo& n+y'am str'i/...(bud med phan tshun/) pa raspa r'i na pum sa kam/...(pha rol pha rol na ma ning/) aa n+yo& n+y'a mi me br'a hma noo bho dza ya ta:/... ..(bram ze mo 'di dag phan tshun za bar byed/) yang na /🔽(phan tshun nam gzhan dang gzhan/)...aa n+yo& n+yam /
translated: The last word of the neuter declension is expressed as the thing ending in am.

original: sogs so // ai ti p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'a dhvi @189a * //
analyzed: sogs so // ai ti p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'a dhvi @189a * //
translated: and so on.

original: rukt'assa m'apt'a:/ zhes pa p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na'i mdo las gnyis su brjod pa rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: rukt'assa m'apt'a:/ zhes pa p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na'i mdo las gnyis su brjod pa rnams rdzogs so /
translated: Thus ends the two-fold discourse in the Paṇini Vyakaraṇa Sūtra.

original: // / de rnams kyis brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na gzhung 'grel gyi go don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: // / de rnams kyis brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na gzhung 'grel gyi go don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba las /
translated: Thus, in this Chariot that Leads to the Jewel of Eloquence: Notes on the Text, Commentary, and Examples of Grammar from the Great Treatise on Grammar, the Paṇini Vyakaraṇa,

original: 'phros don tshig gnyis su brjod pa bshad pa'i sde tshan rags pa rnams re zhig rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phros don tshig gnyis su brjod pa bshad pa'i sde tshan rags pa rnams re zhig rdzogs so /
translated: the rough explanation of the two-fold discourse section is completed for the time being.

original: // / ` bla ma dang dpal gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: // / ` bla ma dang dpal gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the guru and to glorious Vajrapāṇi, the lord of secrets.

original: de ltar rtags drug tshig tu bsgrub pa /
analyzed: de ltar rtags drug tshig tu bsgrub pa /
translated: Thus, the proof in six signs

original: mi zad pa'i sde rags rim du bstan pa /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i sde rags rim du bstan pa /
translated: is taught in stages in the Akṣarasamuccaya.

original: bud med du bsgrub pa'i rkyen /
analyzed: bud med du bsgrub pa'i rkyen /
translated: The condition for establishing as a woman

original: byed pa can gyi le'u /
analyzed: byed pa can gyi le'u /
translated: is the chapter on the agent.

original: tshig sdud bzhi /
analyzed: tshig sdud bzhi /
translated: The four collections of words

original: de phan gyi rkyen /
analyzed: de phan gyi rkyen /
translated: The conditions for that.🔽The subsidiary topics and related topics.

original: zhar byung 'phros don dang bcas pa de rnams kyi sup kyi bya ba mtha' dag bshad zin nas /
analyzed: zhar byung 'phros don dang bcas pa de rnams kyi sup kyi bya ba mtha' dag bshad zin nas /
translated: All the actions of the case endings have been explained.🔽Now, the actions of the verbal roots, which are the second group of

original: da ni rnam dbye sde tshan gnyis pa byings las tshig tu bsgrub pa ting gi bya ba rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rnam dbye sde tshan gnyis pa byings las tshig tu bsgrub pa ting gi bya ba rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: case endings, will be explained.

original: de yang 'grel pa'i thog mar ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'grel pa'i thog mar ji skad du /
translated: At the beginning of the commentary, it says:

original: pra kri ti:s'a dza la ty'a dy'a ya y'a dh'a tv'a di r'u pa y'a /
analyzed: pra kri ti:s'a dza la ty'a dy'a ya y'a dh'a tv'a di r'u pa y'a /
translated: Prakṛtiḥ, sājñānalatyāyayādhātvādirūpayā.🔽Byajjyate śabdārūpāṇi paravācyāyasaṃnidheḥ.

original: bya dzyam te shabda r'u p'a ni pa ra ba tya ya sam ni dhe: de bod skad du /
analyzed: bya dzyam te shabda r'u p'a ni pa ra ba tya ya sam ni dhe: de bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dang po rang bzhin rgyal ba de'i //🔽gang gi byings la sogs pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: dang po rang bzhin rgyal ba de'i // gang gi byings la sogs pa'i gzugs //
translated: First, the nature is the Victor,🔽Whose verbal roots and so forth are

original: gsal bar byed pa sgra yi gzugs //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa sgra yi gzugs //
translated: The forms that clarify

original: pha rol rkyen dang sbyor ba'o //🔽zhes pa byung ste /
analyzed: pha rol rkyen dang sbyor ba'o // zhes pa byung ste /
translated: The connection with the other conditions.🔽First, through the power of compassion and aspiration of the natural

original: dang por rang bzhin gyi rgyal ba sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyi thugs rje dang smon lam gyi mthu las /
analyzed: dang por rang bzhin gyi rgyal ba sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyi thugs rje dang smon lam gyi mthu las /
translated: victors, the buddhas, and so forth, the sound of the Dharma arises from🔽the sky and so forth.

original: gang brjod par bya ba'i gzhi byings la sogs pa rnams la sgra de gsal bar bya ba'i brjod bya'i don ston pa'i gzugs su bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang brjod par bya ba'i gzhi byings la sogs pa rnams la sgra de gsal bar bya ba'i brjod bya'i don ston pa'i gzugs su bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: The words are produced in order to establish the meaning of the object to be expressed in the form of the basis, the root, and so on.

original: pha rol gyi rkyen dang sbyor ba'i cho ga la sogs pa byung ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi rkyen dang sbyor ba'i cho ga la sogs pa byung ba'o //
translated: The rules for combining with the conditions of the other side and so on occur.

original: zhes pa'o // dh'a to:byings las so //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // dh'a to:byings las so //
translated: From the root dhato: from the root.

original: byings tshu rol tu yod pa las byings de tshig tu bsgrub pa'i phyir pha rol tu lat la sogs pa'i rnam dbye rnams 'jug go zhes rnam dbye ti sogs kyi 'jug yul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byings tshu rol tu yod pa las byings de tshig tu bsgrub pa'i phyir pha rol tu lat la sogs pa'i rnam dbye rnams 'jug go zhes rnam dbye ti sogs kyi 'jug yul bstan pa'o //
translated: Since the root exists on this side, in order to establish that root as a word, the case endings la, ta, and so on, are applied on the other side. This is the explanation of the domain of application of the case endings ti and so on.

original: lat la sogs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: lat la sogs pa ci zhe na /
translated: What are the la, and so on?

original: lat / lit /🔽lut / lrit /
analyzed: lat / lit / lut / lrit /
translated: La, lit,

original: lot / lang /🔽ling / lung /
analyzed: lot / lang / ling / lung /
translated: lut, lrit,🔽 lot, lang,🔽 ling, lung,🔽 the aspirated ling,

original: smon pa'i ling /🔽lring rnams so //
analyzed: smon pa'i ling / lring rnams so //
translated: and the long ling.

original: de rnams kyi lat nas lota'i bar lnga ta 'gro ba'i ming can dang / lang nas lring gi bar lnga po rnams nga 'gro ba'i ming can no//🔽@189b brta m'a ne lat /
analyzed: de rnams kyi lat nas lota'i bar lnga ta 'gro ba'i ming can dang / lang nas lring gi bar lnga po rnams nga 'gro ba'i ming can no// @189b brta m'a ne lat /
translated: Among those, the five from la to lot are called the names of the going ta, and the five from lang to ling are called the names of the going nga.🔽 The present is la.

original: da ltar ba la lat 'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba la lat 'o //
translated: The past is ta.🔽 The future is na.🔽 The imperative is ya.🔽 The conditional is na.🔽 The optative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.🔽 The imperative is li.

original: la yig bcu po de rnams kyi nang nas da ltar ba'i bya ba'i don la byings las lat 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la yig bcu po de rnams kyi nang nas da ltar ba'i bya ba'i don la byings las lat 'gyur ro //
translated: From among those ten letters, the present tense is formed from the verbal root by lat.

original: aa t'a bi too /
analyzed: aa t'a bi too /
translated: Atāvito.

original: aa ta dag 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: aa ta dag 'gro ba'o //
translated: Atā means “to go.”

original: lata'i ta yig dang la'i srog gi aa yig dag 'gro ba'i ming can te dbyi'o //
analyzed: lata'i ta yig dang la'i srog gi aa yig dag 'gro ba'i ming can te dbyi'o //
translated: The ta of lat and the life-vowel a of la are the name of the verbal root.

original: tipta sdzhi sipthastha mipbasmast'a t'am dzha th'a s'a th'am dhva mit ba hi ma hing /
analyzed: tipta sdzhi sipthastha mipbasmast'a t'am dzha th'a s'a th'am dhva mit ba hi ma hing /
translated: Tipat sajjhi sipthasthā mipsamstātāṃ jhathā sātāṃ dhwamita vahi mahiṅ.

original: tip tas dzhi sip thas tha mip bas mas ta a'a t'am dzha th'as a'a th'am dhvam ait ba hi ma hing ngo //
analyzed: tip tas dzhi sip thas tha mip bas mas ta a'a t'am dzha th'as a'a th'am dhvam ait ba hi ma hing ngo //
translated: Tipat sajjhi sipthasthā mipsamstātāṃ jhathā sātāṃ dhwamita vahi mahiṅ.

original: lat 'i ta dang aa phyis ba lta bu la yig bcu po de rnams kyi rjes 'brel rnams phyis pas la yig srog med rnams ni tip la sogs pa bco brgyad po 'di rnams su 'gyur ro //🔽la:pa rasmee pa dam /
analyzed: lat 'i ta dang aa phyis ba lta bu la yig bcu po de rnams kyi rjes 'brel rnams phyis pas la yig srog med rnams ni tip la sogs pa bco brgyad po 'di rnams su 'gyur ro // la:pa rasmee pa dam /
translated: The ten letters, having been elided as if the ta and a of lat were elided, the life-vowel-less la becomes these eighteen, tip, and so on.🔽Laḥ parṣmei padam.

original: la rnams pa rasmee pa da'o //
analyzed: la rnams pa rasmee pa da'o //
translated: Laḥ means “to go.”

original: la yig 'gyur ba'i tipa la sogs pa dang po dgu po rnams pa rasmee pa da ste gzhan gyi ched du bya ba'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: la yig 'gyur ba'i tipa la sogs pa dang po dgu po rnams pa rasmee pa da ste gzhan gyi ched du bya ba'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: The first nine, such as tiṅ, are parasmai pada, called “words for the sake of another.”

original: ta d'a n'a b'atma ne pa dam /🔽tang a'an dag a'atma ne pa da'o //
analyzed: ta d'a n'a b'atma ne pa dam / tang a'an dag a'atma ne pa da'o //
translated: Tadānanātma nepadam.🔽Taddhita and kṛt affixes are ātmane pada.

original: tang zhes pa la srog med kyi 'gyur ba ta nas nga'i bar dgu po rnams dang a'a na zhes pa krita sogs kyi rkyen sh'a naca dang k'a natsa dag a'atma ne pa da ste bdag gi ched du bya ba'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: tang zhes pa la srog med kyi 'gyur ba ta nas nga'i bar dgu po rnams dang a'a na zhes pa krita sogs kyi rkyen sh'a naca dang k'a natsa dag a'atma ne pa da ste bdag gi ched du bya ba'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: The nine from ta to na, which are without life, and ān, which is the affix of kṛt and so on, are ātmane pada, called “words for one’s own sake.”

original: she sh'atkarta re pa ra smee pa dam /
analyzed: she sh'atkarta re pa ra smee pa dam /
translated: Śeṣāḥ karttare parasmै padam.

original: lhag ma byed pa la pa ra smee pa da'o //
analyzed: lhag ma byed pa la pa ra smee pa da'o //
translated: The rest are parasmād, for the sake of another.

original: bdag gi ched du bya ba'i tshig rnams ma yin pa'i lhag ma ste tip la sogs pa dgu po rnams pa rasmee pa da zhes bya ste byed po gzhan gyi ched du bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi ched du bya ba'i tshig rnams ma yin pa'i lhag ma ste tip la sogs pa dgu po rnams pa rasmee pa da zhes bya ste byed po gzhan gyi ched du bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: The rest, the nine such as tiṅ, which are not words for one’s own sake, are parasmai pada, called “words for the sake of another agent.”

original: aa nu d'att'a ngi ta a'atma ne pa dam /
analyzed: aa nu d'att'a ngi ta a'atma ne pa dam /
translated: Anudāttoṅgitātma nepadam.

original: aa nu d'atta dang ngit dag gi a'atma ne pa da'o //
analyzed: aa nu d'atta dang ngit dag gi a'atma ne pa da'o //
translated: The roots anu-√dā and ni-√dā have ātmanepada.

original: byings gang la'ang aa nu d'atta ste aatsa skad gdangs dma' bar 'gro ba rnams dang ngita steng 'gro ba rnams a'atma ne ba daste bdag gi ched du bya ba'i tshig gi rnam dbye rnams 'jug ste bdag don gyi byings zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byings gang la'ang aa nu d'atta ste aatsa skad gdangs dma' bar 'gro ba rnams dang ngita steng 'gro ba rnams a'atma ne ba daste bdag gi ched du bya ba'i tshig gi rnam dbye rnams 'jug ste bdag don gyi byings zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In any root, anu-√dā, which has a low pitch, and ni-√dā, which has a high pitch, have ātmanepada, which is the verbal ending for one's own purpose. They are called roots for one's own purpose.

original: sva ri ta nyitstsa au bhe /
analyzed: sva ri ta nyitstsa au bhe /
translated: sva-√ṛt, ni-√tsut, u-√bhū

original: sva ri ta dang nyita kyi gnyis ka'o //
analyzed: sva ri ta dang nyita kyi gnyis ka'o //
translated: Both sva-√ṛt and ni-√tsut.

original: byings gang la sva rita ste sgra skad gsang 'bring po rnams 'gro ba dang nyita ste nya yig 'gro ba rnams ni bdag don dang gzhan don gnyis ka la 'jug pas gnyis ka'i byings zhes so //
analyzed: byings gang la sva rita ste sgra skad gsang 'bring po rnams 'gro ba dang nyita ste nya yig 'gro ba rnams ni bdag don dang gzhan don gnyis ka la 'jug pas gnyis ka'i byings zhes so //
translated: In any root, sva-√ṛt, which has a medium pitch, and ni-√tsut, which has a low pitch, are used for both one's own purpose and the purpose of others. Therefore, they are called roots for both.

original: she she pa rasmee pa dam /
analyzed: she she pa rasmee pa dam /
translated: śeṣe parasmāy padaṃ

original: lhag ma pa rasmee pa da'o //
analyzed: lhag ma pa rasmee pa da'o //
translated: The rest have parasmai pada.

original: gong du bshad pa'i aa nu d'atta dang / nga 'gro ba dang / sva ri ta dang / nya 'gro ba rnams ma yin pa ste de rnams ni gzhan don gyi byings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i aa nu d'atta dang / nga 'gro ba dang / sva ri ta dang / nya 'gro ba rnams ma yin pa ste de rnams ni gzhan don gyi byings zhes bya'o //
translated: The above-mentioned anu-datta, aham-gacchāmi, sv-ṛta, and ny-agacchāmi are not [included]. These are called roots for the benefit of others.

original: ting str'i ni tri n'i pra tha ma ma dhyo motta m'a:/
analyzed: ting str'i ni tri n'i pra tha ma ma dhyo motta m'a:/
translated: Ting, sat, trī, na, pratha, madhya, uttamaḥ.

original: @190a * // ting gi gsum gsum rnams dang po dbus ma phyi ma rnams so //
analyzed: @190a * // ting gi gsum gsum rnams dang po dbus ma phyi ma rnams so //
translated: The three ting, the first, middle, and last.

original: ting zhes pa so sor bsdu ba ste ti nas nga'i bar yin la /
analyzed: ting zhes pa so sor bsdu ba ste ti nas nga'i bar yin la /
translated: Ting is the collection of each, from ti to na.

original: de rnams bco brgyad po las a'atma ne pa da dgu dang / pa rasmee ba da dgu las gsum gsum du gnas pa la snga ma gsum skyes bu dang po dang dbus ma gsum skyes bu dbus ma dang phyi ma gsum skyes bu phyi ma'o //
analyzed: de rnams bco brgyad po las a'atma ne pa da dgu dang / pa rasmee ba da dgu las gsum gsum du gnas pa la snga ma gsum skyes bu dang po dang dbus ma gsum skyes bu dbus ma dang phyi ma gsum skyes bu phyi ma'o //
translated: From those eighteen, atmane pada has nine, and parasmai pada has nine. From those three each, the first three are for the first person, the middle three are for the middle person, and the last three are for the last person.

original: t'a n+ye ka ba tsa na dvi ba tsa na ba hu pa tsa n'a n+ye ka sha: de rnams re la gcig tshig gnyis tshig mang tshig rnams so //
analyzed: t'a n+ye ka ba tsa na dvi ba tsa na ba hu pa tsa n'a n+ye ka sha: de rnams re la gcig tshig gnyis tshig mang tshig rnams so //
translated: Tānyeka-vacana, dvi-vacana, bahu-vacana, anyekaśaḥ. Those have one word, two words, many words, and one each.

original: tip la sogs pa gsum gsum du bcad pa de rnams re re la'ang gcig tshig gnyis tshig mang tshig rnams su yod do //
analyzed: tip la sogs pa gsum gsum du bcad pa de rnams re re la'ang gcig tshig gnyis tshig mang tshig rnams su yod do //
translated: Each of these three divisions of tipa, etc., has three subdivisions: single-syllable, double-syllable, and multiple-syllable.

original: shi she pra ma: lhag ma la dang po'o //
analyzed: shi she pra ma: lhag ma la dang po'o //
translated: The remainder is the first.

original: tip la sogs pa rnams kyi skyes bu dang po dbus ma phyi ma gsum las nye ba'i tshig ste dang por bzhag pa'i tshig de yusmad dang aasmad gnyis ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: tip la sogs pa rnams kyi skyes bu dang po dbus ma phyi ma gsum las nye ba'i tshig ste dang por bzhag pa'i tshig de yusmad dang aasmad gnyis ma yin pa ste /
translated: The first person of tipa, etc., is a proximate term, and the first person is not the second or third of the three.

original: spangs pa'i lhag ma tshig gang dang sbyor yang skyes bu dang po gsum po 'jug go zhes pa spyir btang ba'o //🔽yushma dyu pa de sa m'a dhi ka ra ne sth'a ni n+ya pi ma dhya ma: yushmad nye ba'i tshig mnyam pa'i lhag par byed pa gnas pa las kyang dbus ma'o //
analyzed: spangs pa'i lhag ma tshig gang dang sbyor yang skyes bu dang po gsum po 'jug go zhes pa spyir btang ba'o // yushma dyu pa de sa m'a dhi ka ra ne sth'a ni n+ya pi ma dhya ma: yushmad nye ba'i tshig mnyam pa'i lhag par byed pa gnas pa las kyang dbus ma'o //
translated: The remainder, whatever word it is joined to, the first person of the three is used. This is the general rule.🔽The proximate term yuṣmad is in the middle when there is equality of the agent.

original: yushmad nye ba'i tshig tu gnas pa las mnyam pa'i lhag par byed pa ste de dang sbyor ba'i byings de la skyes bu dbus ma gsum po 'jug go //
analyzed: yushmad nye ba'i tshig tu gnas pa las mnyam pa'i lhag par byed pa ste de dang sbyor ba'i byings de la skyes bu dbus ma gsum po 'jug go //
translated: The proximate term yuṣmad is in the middle when there is equality of the agent. The root that is joined to that, the middle person of the three is used.

original: aasma dyutta ma /
analyzed: aasma dyutta ma /
translated: asmad-dyuti-

original: aasmad la phyi ma'o //
analyzed: aasmad la phyi ma'o //
translated: asmad-dyuti-

original: nye ba'i tshig aa smad yin na de dang sbyor ba'i byings de la skyes bu phyi ma rnams 'jug go //
analyzed: nye ba'i tshig aa smad yin na de dang sbyor ba'i byings de la skyes bu phyi ma rnams 'jug go //
translated: If the secondary suffix asmad is added, then the suffix lat is added to that root.

original: de ltar 'jug yul bshad nas da ni de rnams kyi cho ga rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug yul bshad nas da ni de rnams kyi cho ga rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the objects of entry in that way, now the rules of those will be explained.

original: bh'u yod pa la'o zhes pa'i byings la da ltar ba la lata'o zhes pas lat /
analyzed: bh'u yod pa la'o zhes pa'i byings la da ltar ba la lata'o zhes pas lat /
translated: The root bhu means “to exist.” By the rule “lat is for the present,” lat is added.

original: ting shit+s'arba dh'a tu kam /

original: ting gi sha 'gro ba byings thams cad pa'o //

analyzed: ti sogs kyi bar rkyen sha 'gro ba 'jug pa de la byings thams cad pa'i rnam dbye zhes brda chad byed do //
